byline.contributor: Mitch Smith and Abby Goodnough contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and JULIE BOSMAN

abstract: Emails released by Michigan Gov Rick Snyder's administration reveal his top aides were aware of and alarmed by contaminated water in city of Flint full year before any significant action was taken; emails raise questions about why it took so long for any state action, although there is no indication Snyder was informed about aides' concerns.
lead_paragraph: Newly released emails show that aides to Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan were concerned about the quality of Flint’s water a year before he told residents to stop drinking it.

headline.main: Emails Show Michigan Aides Worried About Flint’s Water a Year Before Acting
headline.print_headline: Emails Show Michigan Aides Worried About Flint’s Water a Year Before Acting

snippet: Newly released emails show that aides to Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan were concerned about the quality of Flint’s water a year before he told residents to stop drinking it.
